description: The Inca Lily, Alstroemeria ligtu subsp. incarnata, is an amazing plant species packed with unique features. Its flowers grow in clusters of vibrant, multi-colored petals organized in a gentle cup shape on long stems. The Inca Lily is renowned for having the longest vase life of any cut flower, meaning they can last up to two weeks after they have been picked. Besides flowers, the Inca Lily produces edible seed pods that taste like potatoes when cooked. It is considered a hearty and low maintenance plant, needing only regular watering and pruning to thrive. With its distinct colors, incredible endurance, and edible bounty, the Inca Lily is truly a must-have for any garden.
